answers.answer: You can have soda, I wouldn't drink that many in a day as you need to stay hydrated..so trying drinking more water..I have one soda a day, 2 at the max!
Your Dr. or Midwife will suggest you cut back that much caffeine or even soda for that matter isn't good for either you or the baby.

Ditto the above.  Try cutting it with sparkling water (not soda water, too much salt!) until it tastes normal diluted.  And try to keep it well under two cans a day.  If it's diet, it's full of nasty chemicals, and if it is not, it is full of high-fructose corn syrup (equivalent of 12 teaspoons of sugar per can), and both ways it has lots of caffeine.  The sugar thing is not fanciful ... some recent research suggests that babies born to women who drank a lot of sugared drinks during pregnancy are more likely to get diabetes.  Take care, try to cut way, way back.

I drank alot of soda with my first pregnancy and this one as well, and both babies are fine. i still drank water but my doctor told me that she didnt want me cutting it out completely cause of how addicted i am to it. but i do only drank 2 maybe 3 a day.
you're generally allowed up to 200mg caffeine a day, and that covers all your soda, tea, coffee, chocolate, medication etc.  x
